dct_description_sm: Relief shown by 10 meter contours. Compiled and drawn by C.I.U., Feb. 1943. Ground information supplied by I. S. T. D. Photolithographed at the War Office, 1943. AMS 2. Reprinted 1944 by A.M.S. 2-44. 133319. Southern Italy Grid; Grid North is 0°58ʹ W of True North. Grid is approximate. Includes index to military and police barracks, banks and insurance offices, factories (state, municipal, and private), public utilities, railway shops, hospitals and hospices, museums, art galleries, libraries, ecclesiastical colleges, scholastic and research institutes, theaters, hotels, buildings in Vatican City, and government, municipal, and fascist establishments. Great Britain. War Office. General Staff. Geographical Section. G.S.G.S. no. 4380 Alternate tilte: Roma, Italy. Sheet 1: Town plan of Roma (Rome) (north sheet). Sheet 2: Town plan of Roma (Rome) south sheet. In upper left margin: Italy. "Ground information supplied by I. S. T. D." United States. Army Map Service
dct_creator_sm: Great Britain. Royal Air Force. Central Interpretation Unit
dct_publisher_sm: [London] : War Office. General Staff. Geographical Section, 1943.
Washington, D.C. : Army Map Service, U.S. Army, 1943.
